snippet.title: One day after DC police's reasonable camera policy, phone still taken
snippet.description: ...On July 20, just 24 hours after a new camera policywas enacted by the Metropolitan Police Department of Washington, DCyou guessed itthe cops still took a guys phone. The new policy forbids the confiscation of cameras and cameraphones, and disallows police from ordering citizens to stop filming...

snippet.title: Washington Post launches Photosynth series
snippet.description: ...The Washington Post's Web site has launched its first Photosynth series on Washington-area monuments and museums, becoming the first to digitally take users inside the historic D.C. landmarks. The series kicked off yesterday on President Lincoln's birthday, with a virtual tour of the Lincoln Memorial that includes a 360 degree view and the ability to zoom in close enough to see the smal...

snippet.title: Apple submitting fourth plan for Georgetown Apple Store
snippet.description: ...There are a few Apple Stores surrounding Washington, D.C., but even though the Apple Store concept has been around for a while, there isn't actually an Apple Store inside D.C. itself. As you might expect, Apple is trying to change that, and the Washington Post has the details...
